page.title: 03Exmoor in the Domesday book
page.content: These extracts show human settlement of Exmoor 900 years ago.Roger of Courseulles was one of the Norman followers of William the Conqueror. Almsworthy Roger of Courseulles holds 'Almsworthy' himself. Edric held it before 1066; it paid tax for 1 virgate of land for 6 ploughs. In lordship 1 plough; 2 slaves; \ virgate. 6 villagers and 9 smallholders with 3 ploughs 8\ virgate.Meadow, 8 acres; underwood, 30 acres; pasture 2 leagues long and 2 wide. 1 cob;6 cattle;47 sheep;27 goats. Value 25's;when he equired it,it was completely waste. ('ALMSWORTHY'is no longer inhabited.)
